abstract: Wall Street has largely recovered from 2008 financial crisis it helped to create; financial sector reports rise in employment, wages and mergers, with profits not far from 2007 highs, highlighting how industry remains nearly as big as it was in past; critics argue that large financial sector can damage overall economic growth by stealing away talented workers from other industries, triggering boom-and-bust cycles and increasing debt levels.
lead_paragraph: Employment, compensation and mergers have all bounced back in the financial sector, and profits are not far from their 2007 highs.

headline.main: Wall Street Is Back, Almost as Big as Ever
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Puts Crisis Behind, and Prospers

snippet: Employment, compensation and mergers have all bounced back in the financial sector, and profits are not far from their 2007 highs.
